pageTitle: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Managed Services Guide, Release 9.0(1) - Cisco Unified Communications Manager systems management and monitoring [Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CallManager)] - Cisco
title: Table 8 Summary of CLI commands and GUI selections
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {32246=The Appliance's software image contains all security updates and patches made to firmware, drivers, native OS, database and Cisco Unified CM application components. Customers who keep current with Cisco maintenance releases are automatically covered for security updates. For more details, refer to the Application Note "Appliance Security Update Process for Cisco Unified Communications Manager" (C27-412838-00), available on request from your Cisco account team.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {46774=Cisco CDP advertises Cisco Unified Communications Manager to other applications, so the application, for example, SNMP or CiscoWorks2000, can perform network management tasks for Cisco Unified Communications Manager., 36445=This service provides SNMP access to variables that are defined in RFC 1213, which read and write variables; for example, system, interfaces, IP, and so on.}
textBeforeTable: The following table provides a summary of the CLI commands and GUI selections that you can use to gather information troubleshoot various system problems. Cisco Unified Communications Manager server with root access disabled. This section provides a quick reference for commands and utilities to help you troubleshoot a Useful commands and utilities When you switch versions by using Cisco Unified Communications Operating System Administration or the CLI, you get a message reminding you about the requirement to reset database replication if you are reverting to an older product release. If you revert the servers in a cluster to run an older product release, you must manually reset database replication within the cluster. To reset database replication after you revert all the cluster servers to the older product release, use the utils dbreplication reset command all on the publisher server. Reset database replication when reverting to prior release Then, use the utils dbreplication stop and then utils dbreplication reset all commands on the publisher server. If the servers are not in Replication State 2, use the utils dbreplication stop command on all subscriber servers. Solution
